div.p: Maryland State Superintendent of Schools Karen Salmon announced April 17, the closure of all public schools in Maryland, including Charles County Public Schools (CCPS), through Friday, May 15, 2020. The closure is part of the state’s efforts to limit the spread of coronavirus (COVID-19).

The deadline for parents to request a laptop for their child to use for distance learning is next Friday, April 24. The CCPS technology department is still working to configure over 5,000 laptops requested. Principals will contact parents for laptop pick up as soon as their child’s laptop is ready. Parents can request laptops through Ask CCPS on the school system website.

Children 18 and younger can pick up three free meals at 11 designated school sites around the county — Henry E. Lackey, Maurice J. McDonough, St. Charles and Westlake high schools, Milton M. Somers Middle School, Dr. Thomas L. Higdon, Indian Head, Mt. Hope/Nanjemoy, Dr. Mudd, J.C. Parks and J.P. Ryon elementary schools.
During the school closure, CCPS school nurses are staffing the COVID-19 call center providing information, support and reassurance to the public

br.br:

td.p: MyPaymentsPlus is linked directly to your school’s student information system (SIS), enabling us to show real-time balances and invoices, and eliminating the need to call or visit your school in search of information.

Whether you’re viewing what your 2nd grader ate for lunch, renting a locker for your middle schooler, or purchasing a parking permit for that new driver in your family, MyPaymentsPlus ensures you never miss a beat, from Pre-K to graduation day.
Simply create a free MyPaymentsPlus account to get started today.

div.p:
04.19.2020 4:30 pm - 5:59 pm
2019 Charles County Spelling Bee

td.p: Catch a jam packed edition of NewsBreak hosted by Madelyn Mudd. Learn what you do at a Hackathon, why doors at North Point High School were decorated with famous faces, why William A. Diggs students were in costume one evening and why Mary H. Matula students and staff turned the page on the dress code during the last week of February.

div.p:
Coronavirus Information
Schools are closed through Friday, May 15. For all the latest information, click the link above or find it in the Quick Links menus.
How to Submit Proofs of Domicile/Transition Proofs
Students in Grades 5 and 8 must have updated proofs on file before the 2020-21 school year begins. To find out how to submit the documents, click the link above or find it in the Parents menu.
Middle and High School Distance Learning Packets
For the packets for April 20 - May 1, click the link above or find it in the Quick Links menu.
Elementary Distance Learning
For the packets for April 20 - May 1, click the link above or find it in the Quick Links menu.
Distance Learning
On April 15, CCPS will launch the next phase of Distance Learning which is the addition of Microsoft Teams. For information, click the link above or find it in the Quick Links menu.
